title: How to complete A Dead End in Arc Raiders
partialText: Find Mantikor's underground facilities and search the locked room for Shani.

title: The company behind the machines that make pretty much all our computer chips reckons it has worked out how to increase production capacity by 50%
partialText: All it takes is a little more light...

title: How to complete Worth Your Salt in Arc Raiders
partialText: Power up the battery prototype.

title: This AI bot roasts any website URL you give it and it's hilariously, scathingly mean
partialText: And yes, I've tried PC Gamer. It'd be unfair not to, right?

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance's fractious creative director Daniel Vávra won't lead Warhorse's next game—It's not a 'breakup,' he's just making the Kingdom Come film
partialText: He's being replaced by a creative directorial hivemind of vets Prokop Jirsa and Viktor Bocan.

title: The Witch's Bakery gives me all the fuzzy feelings of eating a fresh croissant on a warm spring morning
partialText: Dreaming of pastry.

title: Phasmophobia's most popular map is getting a major rework, making this the only acceptable time to be excited by the phrase 'a new surprise in the basement'
partialText: Train's haunted.

title: Obsidian Moon is a Lovecraftian noir detective game about moving bits of paper around your desk and making sure you've got enough money for whiskey and beans
partialText: You can try the demo free on Steam now.

title: Abxylute 3D One review
partialText: It's the world's only glasses-free 3D gaming handheld... for a reason.

title: How to get a Comet Igniter in Arc Raiders
partialText: Grab this material for the new Weather Monitoring System project.

title: The director of the first Assassin's Creed with naval battles found it 'bizarre' to watch Skull and Bones' agonisingly long development, because it was 'essentially the same stuff re-shipping 14 years after we made it'
partialText: The director of the first Assassin's Creed with naval battles found it 'bizarre' to watch Skull and Bones' agonisingly long development, because it was 'essentially the same stuff re-shipping 14 years after we made it'

title: How to complete Keeping an Eye Out in Arc Raiders
partialText: Find Bilguun's shelter near the collapsed highway.

title: Devs behind GoldenEye, Perfect Dark and TimeSplitters are done with big shooters after getting burned by Embracer, so their next game is a Balatro-like twist on Scrabble—and you can try the demo now
partialText: Beyond Words is part of Steam Next Fest.

title: This YouTuber's homebrew VR headset using mini CRTs is way cooler and more usable than you would ever imagine
partialText: Gordon Gekko would approve...

title: How to complete Stable Housing in Arc Raiders
partialText: Crack open the safe in Stella Montis.

title: All Garden Horizons codes for February 2026: Shillings and Seeds
partialText: All active Garden Horizons codes for Shillings and seed packs.

title: Panopticon patch Tuesday: Twitch requires Peter Thiel-funded Persona ID verification for some Affiliates to get their first payouts
partialText: I think I'll skip this particular patch.

title: After a decade of stale turn-based tactics, Menace is a breath of fresh air
partialText: The Battle Brothers makers have done it again, this time with a platoon-scale wargame.

title: The creators of Rain World were tired of making something so depressing, so their next game is a 'loud and dumb and fast' cyberpunk racer you can try in the Steam Next Fest
partialText: It's like if F-Zero broke up the races so you could have Smash Bros. brawls.

title: OG Diablo 2 devs are 'proud' their classic is still getting love, even as they compete for attention with a new ARPG: 'We feel the pressure, but I don't hate them for it'
partialText: As Blizzard breathes new life into Diablo 2, some of its original creators are back on the scene with an ambitious new ARPG called Darkhaven.

title: Blizzard will take it slow with World of Warcraft balance updates after the Midnight expansion drops
partialText: Blizzard is setting expectations for what to expect in the first few weeks of the expansion.

title: 'We couldn’t even have imagined this': Co-op pirate survival game Windrose has been wishlisted over 1 million times
partialText: The swashbuckling survival adventure is a hit before it's even out.

title: 'Father of the Xbox' predicts the end following Phil Spencer's exit: The new CEO will be 'a palliative care doctor who slides Xbox gently into the night'
partialText: Seamus Blackley says Microsoft's focus is on AI, and all else will be subsumed into it.

title: Amazon expected this co-op party game to draw in 100,000+ active players, but it hit an all-time peak of just 320 on Steam and now it's closing for good just 6 months after it launched
partialText: Few games encapsulate all that was wrong with Amazon's approach to making games more aptly than King of Meat.

title: I've already played the demo of this co-op pirate survival game for 7 hours, but the boisterous sea shanties my crew sings keep me coming back for more
partialText: The demo for Windrose is a rollicking pirate adventure—once you've chopped down enough trees, that is.

title: The latest Steam Next Fest features a pile of Palworld-likes as witches and airships battle over the creature-collecting survival subgenre
partialText: I can only assume there's a Nintendo lawyer seething somewhere.

title: There's still no word on a Nier 3, but series mastermind Yoko Taro is writing a new Neon Genesis Evangelion anime series
partialText: Couldn't have picked a better guy for the job.

title: Steam Next Fest is back and you've once again got just 7 days to find your favorite demos among hundreds of choices
partialText: The February 2026 edition of the Steam Next Fest is live now and runs until March 2.

title: Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag creative director returns to help 'steer the brand’s ambitious new chapter'
partialText: Ubisoft has announced the new Assassin's Creed leadership team.

title: Rejoice: Arc Raiders is adding beards
partialText: This week, Arc Raiders finally becomes a complete videogame.

title: The new Arc Raiders robot dropping tomorrow is actually two new robots: a 'flying nightmare' flame drone and a meaner Pop
partialText: Another free Raider Deck is on the way, too.

title: Todd Howard says AI's 'not a fad' but 'we're not using it to generate anything… that handcrafted human intention, is what makes things special, and that's where we want to be'
partialText: "You can't ignore it, in terms of it's coming, it's changing."

title: Krafton's new chief AI officer says the company 'uses AI as a tool to amplify human imagination and creativity, not replace it' 3 months after it announced a hiring freeze and launched a voluntary resignation programme
partialText: Sure, buddy.

title: Der8auer has been shattering glass water block windows for testing purposes, and also because it's really fun
partialText: Everyone's got to have a hobby.

title: 'Anyone found to be cheating will be permabanned from playing Marathon forever, no second chances': Bungie's doubling down on security following Arc Raiders' recent struggles
partialText: Don't go running to Bungie support to save you.

title: 15 years after it was shut down, Star Wars Galaxies is still getting massive updates thanks to this restoration project—like a Helldivers-style galactic civil war
partialText: What could've been, is.

title: After playing the free demo of this bloody medieval carve-'em-up, I'm praying the devs deliver a holy gaming experience
partialText: Vengeance will be mine

title: 'I had to RUN to my Mac mini like I was defusing a bomb': OpenClaw AI chose to 'speedrun' deleting Meta AI safety director's inbox due to a 'rookie error'
partialText: Not the kind of error you want an AI director of safety and alignment making.

title: A UK redditor flew to New York City to buy 280 TBs worth of HDDs to avoid 'literally ridiculous' pricing, declares it was 'worth it in the end'
partialText: I would fly several thousand miles, and I would fly several thousand more...

title: WoW's revisiting old zones for Midnight and The Last Titan because not every story 'has to be told within the context of a new continent'
partialText: "Or island or liminal space. Wherever we're going."

title: Users are reporting MSI's yellow-tipped GPU power cables are sneaking out of place, putting graphics cards at increased risk
partialText: Sneaky cables, get back in there.

title: How to complete Keeping the Memory in Arc Raiders
partialText: Find the missing helmet in the hills.

title: Final Fantasy 14's in-house rock band is heading to one of the UK's biggest music festivals and it feels like my two main friend groups meeting for the first time
partialText: The Primals are coming to the UK, baby.

title: Assassin's Creed 3's greatest feature was pushed to the side until Black Flag because Ubisoft was worried that 'the tech wouldn't work'
partialText: We had to wait another year for a proper high seas adventure.

title: How to complete Source of the Contamination in Arc Raiders
partialText: Don't forget wellies when wading through contaminated water.

title: How to complete Eyes on the Prize in Arc Raiders
partialText: Rewire some solar panels for Tian Wen in the Buried City.

title: How to complete After Rain Comes in Arc Raiders
partialText: Use wires and batteries to repair the solar panels.

title: The Denshattack! demo sees you kickflipping, grinding, and joyriding a Ferris wheel into an active volcano on the world's most tubular commute
partialText: Multi-track drifting is somehow the least wild thing happening, here.

title: Samsung is prepping PCIe 6.0 SSDs already but don't expect to get your hands on them without screw-you AI datacentre money
partialText: 256 TB—yes, terabytes—with double that planned for next year.

title: Where to find salt crystals in Disney Dreamlight Valley
partialText: Add a little bit of seasoning to your dish.
